Name: Solar Resource Data

Caption.String: For locations not covered by the NSRDB, visit the SAM website Weather Page for links to other data sources.

SAM's default library comes with only a few weather files to help you get started. Use the download tools below to build a library of locations you frequently model. Once you build your library, it is available for all of your work in SAM.

The NSRDB is a database of thousands of weather files that you can download and add to your to your solar resource library: Download a default typical-year (TMY) file for most long-term cash flow analyses, or choose files to download for single-year or P50/P90 analyses. See Help for details.

SAM scans the following folders on your computer for valid weather files and adds them to your Solar Resource library. To use weather files stored on your computer, click Add/remove Weather File Folders and add folders containing valid weather files.

Description.String: Type or import a list of addresses or lat,lon in decimal degrees

Items.StringList: Default TMY file|Choose year|Download files for all years (P50/P90)

Caption.String: The Solar Resource library is a list of weather files on your computer. Choose a file from the library and verify the weather data information below.

Text.String: List of Solar Resource library folders

Caption.String: Annual Averages Calculated from Weather File  Data

For NSRDB data, the latitude and longitude shown here from the weather file header are the coordinates of the NSRDB grid cell and may be different from the values in the file name, which are the coordinates of the requested location.

file_name.Label: Weather file name required by some SSC modules

in_location.Label: Location input (address or lat/lon)
in_location.DefaultValue: Type a street address or latitude, longitude (skip for advanced)

library_paths.Label: Solar resource library file path list

solar_data_file_name.Label: Weather file name from solar resource library

solar_data_file_name_load.Label: Weather file when user interface loaded

user_specified_weather_file.Label: Weather file specified from script 0 or 1 (legacy)

show('solar_data_file_name_load', false); // stores weather file name when UI form loaded
show('solar_data_file_name', false); // value from SolarResourceData CSV file
update_library_folders(''); // refresh list of library folders

property( 'download_weather_caption' , 'Caption' , 'Click the Download button to choose files from a complete list of files available from the NSRDB, including TMY, TGY, TDY for different years and subhourly data.');

See Help for details.' );

// attempt to determine if location string is valid lat/lon pair
// given a location string loc_in, return:
//  * loc_in if appears to be a location name or address
//  * comma separated lat/lon pair in Decimal Degrees if valid comma or space separated lat/lon pair
//  * null if not a valid lat/lon pair
// also return msg string description if invalid
if ( #arr == 2 && strpos(loc_in,',') < 0 ) // test for space-separated lat/lon, city/state, or city/country pair
msg = '\"' + loc_in + '\"' + ' not recognized. Please use a comma to separate latitude and longitude values in Decimal Degrees, or to separate city and state/province or country names.';
elseif ( #arr > 2 ) // test for street address with one comma
str = replace( loc_in, ', ', ',' ); // allow comma followed by space
if ( #arr == 2 && !is_space_delimited_pair && !is_space_delimited_address) // loc_in may be a lat/lon pair
if ( (to_real(lat) !=0)  && (to_real(lon) != 0) ) // test for N, S, E, or W in string (not valid for decimal degrees)
is_string = ( to_real(lat) == 0 && to_real(lon) == 0 ); // assumes no one is modeling a system at 0,0
msg = '\"' + loc_in + '\"' + ' is not a valid lat/lon pair in Decimal Degrees (uses N/S, E/W). Please convert to Decimal Degrees.';
msg = '\"' + loc_in + '\"' + ' appears to be a city/state pair.';
msg = '\"' + loc_in + '\"' + ' appears to be a valid lat/lon pair in Decimal Degrees.';
msg = '\"' + loc_in + '\"' + ' not recognized. Please enter a valid street address, location name, or latitude/longitude pair in Decimal Degrees (lat,lon).';
elseif ( !is_space_delimited_pair ) // loc_in likely a location name
msg = '\"' + loc_in + '\"' + ' appears to be a street address or location name.';
// given a key or file item from the library, return if exists t/f, key, file, and key for first item

// is_key = false if file name with full path and extension
// should also work with no parameters to return number of files in library and in deploy/solar_resource folder
for( i=0; i<#files; i++) { files[i] = lower(slash_back_to_forward(files[i])); }
// update weather file, annual summaries and summary text based on whether file is from library or user specified via LK script

msg_caption = 'The weather file is different from the file selected in the library because it was modified by an LK script. Click Add File to Library if you want the file to appear in the library list above.';

msg_caption = 'Weather file folder not in list? Please choose or download a different file above, or click Add file to library.';
msg_caption = 'Weather file is not in library. Please choose or download a different file above, or click Add file to library.';
msg_caption = 'The following information describes the data in the highlighted weather file from the Solar Resource library above. This is the file SAM will use when you click Simulate.';

str = 'CSP models use a different time convention than NREL NSRDB data. See Help for details.';
str += str_and + 'relative humidity data. See Help for details.';
// clean up location string to use as file name
// return a set of urls for valid datasets available for a location
// sometimes correct address fails but works on second try
msg += 'Latitude / longitude for NSRDB Data Query: ' + g.lat + ',' + g.lon +  '\n\n';
msg += 'URL for NSRDB Data Query: ' + url + '\n\n';
msg += 'Message from NSRDB Data Query: ' + var.errors[0] + '.\nStatus = ' + var.status;
msg += 'NSRDB Data Query Error: ' + var.error.message + '.\nCode = ' + var.error.code;
if ( strpos( lower(var.code), 'api' ) > -1 ) { msg += 'See private.h to set API keys.'; }

msg += 'NSRDB Data Query returns no data for \"' + location + '\" (outputs = []).\nSee https://sam.nrel.gov/weather for links to other data sources.\n';

// list of datasets that don't require advanced download

return { 'name' = name , 'msg' = msg , 'is_suny' = is_suny, 'url' = url, 'years' = years , 'ok' = ok_test , 'lat' = g.lat, 'lon' = g.lon };
result = 'Weather file checker could not find file: ' + wf ;
// returns a weather file for the current NSRDB data available for a location
if ( file_exists( log_file ) ) { flog = open( log_file , 'a' ); }
location_list = replace( location_list, '\"', '' ); // files from spreadsheets may use quotes for strings
if ( value( 'in_time_step' ) == HOURLY || download_option == TMY ) // tmy is always hourly
pb_locations = progressbar( { 'title' = 'Download Progress' , 'message' = 'Starting download.' , 'cancelbutton' = false , 'closebutton' = false , 'time' = false , 'max' = #location } );
progressbar( pb_locations, { 'message' = 'Getting download information for \"' + location[n] + '\".' , 'value' = 1+n } );
progressbar( pb_locations, { 'message' = 'Processing download information for \"' + location[n] + '\".' , 'value' = 1+n } );
if ( download_option == TMY ) // this needs to work for both psm3-tmy and suny-india-tmy
type = ['tmy']; // should get newest TMY file for psm3-tmy, or tmy for suny-india-tmy
msgbox('Only 60-minute data is available for suny-india dataset.\nTry the Advanced Download option to see of other datasets are available for this location.');
write_line( flog, 'Only 60-minute data available for suny-india dataset.\n' );
y = choose_from_list( dataset[n].years, 'Choose a year', 'Available Years for \"' + location[n] +'\"', 0 );
write_line( flog, 'Year not valid: Selection cancelled by user.\n' );
// create folder for multiple years to facilitate

pb_years = progressbar( { 'title' = 'Download Progress for ' + location[n] , 'message' = 'Downloading, please wait...', 'cancelbutton' = false , 'closebutton' = false , 'time' = false , 'max' = #type } );
// only get attributes SAM needs for simulations
// otherwise default is to get all attributes
fname = path + '/' + clean_name( location[n] ) + '_' + dataset[n].lat + '_' + dataset[n].lon + '_' + dataset[n].name + '_' + time_step + '_' + type[i] + '.csv';
curl_ok = curl( url , { 'file'= fname } ); // curl() should replace <SAMAPI> from private.h and <USEREMAIL > from registry
write_line( flog, 'Failed to download file from NSRDB: cURL failed.');
msg += ('Failed to download weather file ' + fname + '\n');
if ( wf_error != "0" ) // usually indicates NSRDB returned a file containing error message instead of weather data
write_line( flog, 'Weather file test failed, ' + wf_error + ': ' + fname + '.\n');
if ( #file_text < 1000 ) // probably JSON returned by NSRDB
if ( strpos( var_err, 'json-error') > -1 ) // JSON not valid (could be HTML message from server)
msg += 'Expected JSON from NSRDB is not valid. This could indicate that the NSRDB service is down.';
else // valid JSON with error message
msg += 'Weather file test failed for ' + file_only( fname ) + '.\n';
fname_new = replace( fname, '.csv' , '_bad.txt' ); // rename file so next download attempt won't detect existing file
write_line( flog, '* File renamed to: ' + fname_new + '.\n' );
write_line( flog, '* Failed to rename ' + fname + '.\n' );
// set library to last file that was downloaded and passed weather file test
write_line( flog, 'Weather file test passed: ' + fname + '.\n');
str += 'Do you want to show instructions for running a P50/P90 analysis now?';
+ '1. Click P50 / P90 at the bottom left of the main SAM window.\n\n'
+ '2. Click the ellipses (...) to the right of the Select Weather File Folder box.\n\n'
+ '\nIf you want to set a custom P value in addition to P10, P50 and P90, you can type a value for "Custom Px" before running the simulations.'
+ '\n\nTo remove this note window, delete all of its contents and close the window.';
show_log = yesno( 'Download Messages\n' + msg + '\nOpen log file?');
